I don't think that article is very believable. Obesity leading to diabetes, for one thing, the medical care a diabetic needs can cost a small fortune before the person succumbs to complications of diabetes, they don't die due to obesity. The cost of all disease caused by alcoholism, smoking, obesity could be eliminated if people just didn't do these things.

LOL! emoticon_xgood for the article. People are killing themselves by smoking and overeating, and while I agree with Duo that it won't save SS by itself, it might just help.
 
 On the SS front, if congress hadn't taken money out in the 50's and 60's, SS would likely be solvent. But the money removed was to be paid back without interest so for the time it was gone out of the SS system, no interest was gained. So blame congress (which has its own very secure retirement system) for messing it up for the rest of us.
